name: The Bigger the Better Down Under! Quiz  | 10 Questions

questions.text: What marine Big Thing is on display near a butterfly farm in a far north Queensland town?
questions.explanation:
Barramundi.

	The Big Barramundi is a fibreglass replica of a giant fish on the roof of the general store in the town of Daintree.  The Barramundi is an Australian freshwater 'fighting' fish which tastes pretty damn good!

questions.text: What animal Big Thing sits near the visitors information centre in a major town in the Hunter Valley in New South Wales?
questions.explanation:
Blue Heeler.

	The Australian Cattle Dog aka the Blue Heeler was originally bred in the 1840's just north of Muswellbrook in the beautiful Hunter Valley.  Blue Heeler is also the name of a Western Australian based clothing company and a very popular Australian television drama series (a 'Cop' show).

questions.text: On the northside of this New South Wales town is another Big Thing, sited near a park called Fotheringham Park.  What is it?
questions.explanation:
Oyster.

	The Big Oyster, on the outskirts of Taree in New South Wales, is described as looking more like a clam!  The same people who erected the Big Prawn at Ballina, New South Wales (which is lit up at night), were responsible for this creation too.

questions.text: What Big Thing of the marine variety, can be viewed from lookouts near to a 'desert' town in South Australia?
questions.explanation:
Whale.

	In Nullarbor, South Australia, halfway between Adelaide and Port Augusta is the Big Whale.  Situated on the Eyre Highway, a desolate stretch of road, you can see the Great Australian Bight from nearby lookouts, hence the Big Whale.

questions.text: What Big Thing sits atop the verandah roof of The Grand Hotel in a town between Dubbo and Broken Hill in western New South Wales?
questions.explanation:
Beer can.

	The Big Beer Can (or the Big Tinnie) is a giant replica of a can of 'Tooheys New' beer which graces the Grand Hotel in Cobar, a rural town in New South Wales which was once a mining 'hub' called 'Copper City'. There is also a big can of Victoria Bitter in Hervey Bay, Queensland.

questions.text: What citrus Big Thing is in a Queensland town north west of Brisbane on the Burnett River?
questions.explanation:
Mandarin.

	In the town of Mundubbera, the self proclaimed 'Citrus Capital of Queensland', is the Big Mandarin, sometimes called the 'Enormous Ellendale'!  It is located at the Golden Mile Orchard which has the reputation of being the largest citrus orchard in the southern hemisphere.

questions.text: What Big Thing is located near Nambour, Queensland, on the same plantation as the Big Pineapple?
questions.explanation:
Macadamia.

	The Big Macadamia is on the Bruce Highway at Woombye, near Nambour, Queensland.  From the spiral stair walk of the Big Pineapple you can view the Big Macadamia.  You can also ride the 'Nut Train'. It's great, and free to boot!

questions.text: What Big Thing is located at the entrance to a winery off the Sturt Highway in New South Wales?
questions.explanation:
Wine cask.

	The Buronga Hill Winery in Wentworth is one of the largest in Australia and The Big Wine Cask is a Stanley Wines Australian Riesling, which would probably hold over 400,000 litres.

questions.text: What type of big bird is the Big Thing located in the town of Mission Beach, Queensland?
questions.explanation:
Cassowary.

	You enter Mission Beach via a road known as Cassowary Drive and you'll be warned to beware of cassowaries, but the only one you'll probably see is the Big Cassowary!  There's also a Big Brolga in Townsville, Queensland.

questions.text: Which fruity Big Thing is located at Tweed Heads in northern New South Wales?
questions.explanation:
Avocado.

	The Big Avocado is at the entrance of what was Avocado Adventure Land, it is now Duranbah's Tropical Fruit World, in the northern New South Wales tourist 'twin' town of Tweed Heads.
